Posts.Content: May 18, 2009 09:34AM gmp300 wrote: Hi Susan13,  you wrote that you had chemo twice and that you didn't loose all of your hair  with your last treatment of taxotere.  What other chemo drug were you on ?  Also did you shave your head when your hair started falling out or just cut it short?  Your picture looks great and hopeful expecially after getting chemo twice.  I was wondering if maybe you didn't shave your head and only getting bald spots and thinning helped your hair to grow in  and blend in faster?  Let me know how you did it, it would be very much appreciated!   Thank You and Best Wishes --Geri

Posts.Content: May 26, 2009 10:03PM gmp300 wrote: Hi Everyone--Well I did alot of research and talked to a doctor here in Michigan who did a trial on Penguin Cold Caps ,  the scientist who invented them (very nice man). Also a few women who have tried it and are doing it right now with excellent results.  I have decided to give them a try!  The results are very encouraging and I figured that I don't have nothing to loose but my hair!  If I keep it I will be very very happy to get all of this behind me.  If I loose it I will cope.  Either way Iam very excited to try it and share my experience with whoever is interested.  If nothing else, Iam so excited about these cold caps that I've hardly thought about starting chemo in 1 day!  I'll be to busy changing my caps avery 1/2 hr to think about the chemo going thru my veins.     Thank you everyone with all of your input and advice , it helped me get to where Iam now.  Preparing to ice my head!  I'll let you know how it goes---Geri
Posts.Title: Cold Caps to save your hair! gmp300 flacracker

Posts.Content: gmp300 wrote: Hi Everyone--I have been researching the Penguin or Pelican Cold Caps to use during chemo to save your hair from falling out.  They are very popular in Europe etc.  I was wondering if anyone knows more about them, has used them or knows anyone who has tried it.  Just trying to find out if it really works!!  Wouldn't that be a great thing for everyone!  On there website they say 80% of women keep their hair but is it TRUE?  Thanks for any input--Geri Dx 3/23/2009, ILC, <1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Dx 3/23/2009, ILC, <1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2009 03:45AM gmp300 wrote: Hi Geena,  Iam on day4 post op and I feel ok.  My husband has been going to work and I have been fine milking my tubes etc.  I get up using my stomach muscle (couldn't imagine having a flap incision) My arms are not as sore as the first 3 days. I still can't lift them to high.  I was able to shower the day after surgery but didn't feel like it until today.  My daughter washed my hair in the sink I took my own shower but my husband had to clean and bandage the drainage tube site for me .  I could never do it myself.  Hopefully they will come out in a week and I hear things get much better from there.  Besides that I get up and around the house.  Ive even folded laundry.  I just can't reach high or lift much.  Good Luck.  You'll do fine  Geri
Posts.Title: I LIVE ALONE - post bi lat mast help? wabiwoman Jeansbeans

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2009 07:56PM gmp300 wrote: Hi there--Today I had to go in as outpatient to be drained, change my tissue expander and put 1 drain tube back in.  My bs took out my drain tube 1 week after BM w/Te surgery because I was getting an infection.  He put me on Leviquin (antibiotic).  All week I have been filling up with fluid in my breast and under my SNB site.  I have been very uncomfortable and afraid I was going to explode or loose my TE.  I didn't explode and I didn't loose my TE.  My PS did 1 hour surgery.  Went in the same incision, just a little. drained me out, irrtgated it and changed my TE, he also put in a new drain tube.  I came home 3 hours later with a tight sport bra on and I see him on Monday.  Although I was uncomfortable my infection cleared up with antibiotics and my incisions looked  good.  I feel much better now than I did this morning.  I'd rather have the drain than the fluid build up.  That wore me out physically and mentally!  Hopefully I'll get the drain out on Monday since it is not draining to much now, I think I suffered thru the worst of it.  Iam glad he cleaned it out good.  I would hate to end up with a worse infection.  I just thought I would share that in case anyone is experiencing the same thing.  I hope everyone is doing well and I pray for everyone on this site everyday!  ---Geri
